alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:58PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and northern Sheridan Counties through 1045 PM MDT... At 957 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Gordon to near Hay Springs. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Hay Springs, Clinton, Hoover Lake, Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area, Lone Butte, Irwin, Intersection of Beaver Creek Road and White Clay Creek Road, Mount Maria, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 74 and 116, and between mile markers 127 and 128. Highway 250 between mile markers 40 and 48. Highway 61 near mile marker 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
